page.title: 08Transport in West Ashby.
page.content: Public transport is very limited through the Village,there being only two bus services a week. The hourly bus service to Horncastle and Louth of the 1930's has gone.Today there is only the Horncstle Bus Club operating between the two towns on Wednesdays. The bus leaves Horncastle at 9.30a.m. arriving in Louth at 10.30a.m. returns from Louth at 13.30hrs arriving in Horncastle at 14.30hrs.This service is little used by villagers.Thursday is Market day in Horncastle and a local bus company runs a service around several villages. This service picks up in the village at 10.45a.m. and returns at 12.30a.m.this is used regularly by 10/12 villagers who rely on it a great deal.Children under 11 are transported to school in Horncastle by bus.Over 11 they have to make their own way.
